lead_paragraph: People in Mashiki had known a network of fault lines ran under their town. But no major quake had struck in anyone’s lifetime, until two did last week.

headline.print_headline: New Sense of Fragility in Japanese Town Hit by Quakes in Quick Succession
headline.main: New Sense of Fragility in Japanese Town Struck Twice by Quakes

snippet: People in Mashiki had known a network of fault lines ran under their town. But no major quake had struck in anyone’s lifetime, until two did last week.
abstract: Area of far southwestern Japan hit by twin earthquakes has not experienced any seismic activity in generations, giving residents what has turned out to be false sense of security; survivors fear recovery in rural region could take years, especially given fact that much of rural Japan is gripped by downturn in economy and working-age population.
